intro: Trithecanthera, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Trithecanthera acutifolia and Trithecanthera africana. These plants are characterized by their compound leaves and showy, pod-like fruits that contain the seeds. Trithecanthera species are often found in dry, open habitats and are adapted to arid conditions. They have traditional uses in some African communities, including as a source of food and medicinal applications.
